title: eclipse generated try/catch discards exception
description:
The (horrible) eclipse default is something like this:

// TODO: autogenerated stub
e.printStackTrace();



The current eclipse config does this, which is better, but loses the original exc:


throw new RuntimeException()



But it should be:

throw new RuntimeException(${exception_var})

comments.author: Michael McCandless
comments.content:
I don't understand the massive single-line patch, but big +1 for preserving the original exception by default when Eclipse auto-generates a try/catch.

Bad bad eclipse default!
